original_text: FR schemes are similar to nodal DG schemes, which are arguably the most popular type of unstructured high-order method (at least in the field of computational aerodynamics). Like nodal DG schemes, FR schemes utilise a high-order (nodal) polynomial basis to approximate the solution within each element of the computational domain, and like nodal DG schemes, FR schemes do not explicitly enforce inter-element solution continuity. However, unlike nodal DG schemes, FR methods are based solely on the governing system in a differential form. A description of the FR approach in 1D is presented below. For further information see the original paper of Huynh  [2].
original_translation: Los esquemas FR son similares a los esquemas DG nodales, que son probablemente el tipo más popular de método no estructurado de alto orden (al menos en el campo de la aerodinámica computacional). Al igual que los esquemas DG nodales, los esquemas FR utilizan una base polinómica de alto orden (nodal) para aproximar la solución dentro de cada elemento del dominio computacional, y al igual que los esquemas DG nodales, los esquemas FR no imponen explícitamente la continuidad de la solución entre elementos. Sin embargo, a diferencia de los esquemas DG nodales, los métodos FR se basan únicamente en el sistema gobernante en forma diferencial. A continuación se presenta una descripción del enfoque FR en 1D. Para obtener más información, consulte el artículo original de Huynh [2].
original_sentences: FR schemes are similar to nodal DG schemes, which are arguably the most popular type of unstructured high-order method (at least in the field of computational aerodynamics).

Like nodal DG schemes, FR schemes utilise a high-order (nodal) polynomial basis to approximate the solution within each element of the computational domain, and like nodal DG schemes, FR schemes do not explicitly enforce inter-element solution continuity.
However, unlike nodal DG schemes, FR methods are based solely on the governing system in a differential form.
A description of the FR approach in 1D is presented below.
For further information see the original paper of Huynh  [2].

A continuación se presenta una descripción del enfoque FR en 1D.
Para obtener más información, consulte el artículo original de Huynh [2].
